alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN HAMILTON... SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1145 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dunlap, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Mason, Norwood, Forest Park, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Loveland, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming, Mount Healthy, Deer Park, Finneytown, West Chester, and Ross. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 7 and 21. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 8 and 15. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 6 and 25. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
